Package dev.gamekit.ui.widgets

Class Widget

java.lang.Object
dev.gamekit.ui.widgets.Widget
Direct Known Subclasses:
Leaf, Parent
public abstract class Widget extends Object
A widget is an abstract representation of a portion of a Scene's user interface.

Subclasses must implement the performLayout(dev.gamekit.ui.Constraints) and performRender(Graphics2D) to compute their position and size

Widget layout is based on the box-constraint model which is used in Flutter, where constraints go down the tree, size go up and parents set positions

    • layout

      public final void layout(Constraints constraints)
      Computes the layout for the widget

      This is called by either the parent widget or window and receives the Constraints from its parent or the window, and the resulting computed size must always respect this constraint

      The goal of this method is to set the computedBounds which controls where on the screen the widget is rendered.

      Since this method is marked as final, subclasses should override the performLayout(dev.gamekit.ui.Constraints) method instead to perform their layout

    • performLayout

      protected abstract void performLayout(Constraints constraints)
      Delegate method which performs the actual layout and is passed the constraints from layout(Constraints).

    • postLayout

      public final void postLayout()
      Performs post-layout logic

      This exists because layout(Constraints) uses a depth-first approach in traversing this widget tree.

      With this approach, certain data (e.g. computed bounds position and parent computed bounds) may not be available until after the scene's UI widget tree has been completely laid out

      Since this method is marked as final, subclasses should override the performPostLayout() method instead to perform any post layout logic

    • performPostLayout

      protected void performPostLayout()

    • render

      public final void render(Graphics2D canvasGraphics)
      Renders the widget unto the provided BufferedImage

      This method is final and delegates the actual drawing to performRender(Graphics2D).

    • performRender

      protected abstract void performRender(Graphics2D g)
      Delegate method which performs the actual rendering and is passed a Graphics2D object of the widget's canvasImage.
